What Java VM are you using?

What sort of OutOfMemoryErrors are you hitting, and when? What shows up 
in the logs?

(Oddly enough, some kinds of OOMEs can be made more likely by increasing 
the heap size, because they're actually caused by a depletion of some 
resource pool other than the object heap. So it's important to 
understand what kind of OOME is happening; later JVMs give better info.)

That line of memory consumption indicates over 3GB free; in such a 
situation there's no need to be concerned about reported usage unless 
over many successful crawl cycles the 'low-water' mark of usage keeps 
increasing. (If so, it could be useful to analyze what's sticking around 
with other heap-analysis tools -- but at this point what you've 
described doesn't yet definitively indicate that anything is.)

- Gordon @ IA
